verses.verse: All day they twist my words; All their thoughts are against me for evil.
They gather together, They hide, they mark my steps, When they lie in wait for my life.
Shall they escape by iniquity? In anger cast down the peoples, O God!
You number my wanderings; Put my tears into Your bottle; ((Mal. 3:16)) Are they not in Your book?
When I cry out to You, Then my enemies will turn back; This I know, because ((Ps. 118:6; Rom. 8:31)) God is for me.
In God (I will praise His word), In the LORD (I will praise His word),
In God I have put my trust; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
Vows made to You are binding upon me, O God; I will render praises to You,
(Ps. 116:8, 9) For You have delivered my soul from death. Have You not kept my feet from falling, That I may walk before God In the (Job 33:30) light of the living?

Prayer for Safety from Enemies To the Chief Musician. Set to “Do Not Destroy.” A Michtam of David (1 Sam. 22:1) when he fled from Saul into the cave. [1] Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me! For my soul trusts in You; (Ruth 2:12; Ps. 17:8; 63:7) And in the shadow of Your wings I will make my refuge, (Is. 26:20) Until these calamities have passed by.
I will cry out to God Most High, To God ((Ps. 138:8)) who performs all things for me.
